results.title: Elephant parts
results.brief_description: This highly entertaining, Grammy award-winning video by Mike Nesmith, former member of the 60s band, The Monkees (America’s answer to the Beatles) has it all - music, dance, comedy skits, and a cast of thousands! Using satire, nothing in this video is sacred as Nesmith takes a shot at American culture, politics, the Hollywood movie industry and the music industry, game shows, etc etc. Original, clever, witty, “Elephant parts” features several of Nesmith’s songs (all written, produced and sung by Nesmith) including “Rio”, “Cruisin’”, “Magic”, “Tonight” and “Light”. Contains some b&w scenes.

results.title: Elephant baby
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Milan Herzog
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of a baby elephant from its first day in the jungle, through many weeks of training, to the day it joins a working force of elephants in a lumber camp. Photographed in Mysore, India, the film gives an account of the daily activities of working elephants and of the people who train them, including the shooting of a tiger which came too close to the camp for comfort.

results.title: Elephant
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Peter Chermayeff
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary the African elephant on its daily routine of foraging, dusting, playing, roaming anddrinking from a waterhole. Illustrates the elephants physical characteristics. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Elements organised: the periodic table
results.creator_credit: Open University, BBC, Tony Jolly and David Jackson
results.brief_description: A series of excellent demonstrations, with graphics, showing how the great variety in the behaviour of the elements can be organised into a systematic structure, the Periodic Table. Please note that there is some background noise on the tape. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Elements of survival. Part 2. Food
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Doug Lower
results.brief_description: This program explores the myth that there are vast tracts of arable land, capable of supporting human populations, no matter what their numbers. Looking at world politics and economics, as well as the availability of land, water and energy resources, it explores the ever-present wall of hunger that separates the “haves” from the “have nots” and studies possibilities for a more equitable distribution of present food resources.

results.title: Elements of survival. Part 1. Populations
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Doug Lower
results.brief_description: First of a two-part series this episode focuses on the population spiral and looks at mankind from pre-history to the present explosion with its doubling of world population about every 35 years. The film looks at the possible consequences of unchecked growth, and the wide gulf between the haves and the have-nots.

results.title: Elements of electrical circuits
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Morris Meisner
results.brief_description: Reveals the nature of electric currents and circuits, electron motions, conductors, insulators, and factors affecting resistance are a few of the subjects explained through animated drawings and photographic demonstrations.

results.title: Elements
results.brief_description: This program tracks the journey of Western Australia’s natural gas from the North Rankin “A” Gas and Condensate production platform, through its 134 km journey to the Burrup Peninsula and through the liquefication process, concluding with delivery to Japan. The video explains various elements of the LNG plant including the sulfinol column, dehydration unit, scrub column, heat exchanger, storage tanks and control room. The program concludes with details of the LNG ships and their delivery of LNG to Japanese power utilities.

results.title: Elementary mathematics for teachers and students: games
results.creator_credit: General Learning Corporation and Davidson Films
results.brief_description: An animated film for in-service work and the classroom. Two strategy games are played, one of co-ordinates, the second where two players take turns to erase a specified number of marks. Once the children have learnt these games they can progress to other games related to “rim”, eg games that use matches, or boardgames with counters. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Elementary experiments in the chemistry of water
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the following elementary experiments which illustrate the chemistry of water. 1. Exploding one part of oxygen with two parts of hydrogen to form water. 2. Passing an electric current through pure water and salt solution. 3. Burning hydrogen to form water vapour. 4. Electrolysis of water.
